commit_message:
Using internal Resource.to_dict()

We shouldn't use Resource._info because it is a private attribute.
Using internal Resource.to_dict() instead of Resource._info

Change-Id: Ic6f475ac5c4ba3c407b05d9559ec5c3a9f57e2be
Closes-Bug: #1619048
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/34/478834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: node = baremetal_client.node.create(**fields).to_dict() parsed_args.node, fields=fields).to_dict() parsed_args.node, fields=fields).to_dict() interfaces = baremetal_client.node.validate(parsed_args.node).to_dict()
deleted_lines: node = baremetal_client.node.create(**fields)._info parsed_args.node, fields=fields)._info parsed_args.node, fields=fields)._info interfaces = baremetal_client.node.validate(parsed_args.node)._info

commit_message:
Check whether terminal command is available if console enabled

Currently node-set-console-mode encounter an error due to the console
dependency is not available. This patch add console enabled option to
indicate whether to enable the console support. If true, check the
console dependency when loading the console driver.

Change-Id: I7e548db42d8a69e9e736fefb44a5b45305afd948
Closes-bug: #1402547
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/59/235159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :raises: NoCommand when console command can not be found.

commit_message:
Use per-node external_http_url for boot ISO

When the per-node external_http_url feature was introduced by
c197a2d8b24e2fa4c5e7901e448da1b0c93fcd26, it only applied to a config
floppy. This fix ensures that it is also used for the boot ISO, both
when it is generated locally (by _prepare_iso_image()) or just cached
locally (by prepare_remote_image()).

Change-Id: Ic241da6845b4d97fd29888e28cc1d9ee34e182c1
Closes-Bug: #2044314
(cherry picked from commit 0d59e25cf8ae3e531fcca46b20907014a9a92f09)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | The per-node ``external_http_url`` setting in the driver info is now used for a boot ISO. Previously this setting was only used for a config floppy.

commit_message:
Use per-node external_http_url for boot ISO

When the per-node external_http_url feature was introduced by
c197a2d8b24e2fa4c5e7901e448da1b0c93fcd26, it only applied to a config
floppy. This fix ensures that it is also used for the boot ISO, both
when it is generated locally (by _prepare_iso_image()) or just cached
locally (by prepare_remote_image()).

Change-Id: Ic241da6845b4d97fd29888e28cc1d9ee34e182c1
Closes-Bug: #2044314
(cherry picked from commit 0d59e25cf8ae3e531fcca46b20907014a9a92f09)

commit_message:
Limit vgpu inventory to specified device_addresses

When a single enabled_mdev_type is configured and
a corresponding group with device_addresses is
specified then limit the inventory presented to
placement to the specified device_addresses.

Related-Bug: #1981631
Change-Id: I4e72f3ceea5de65ef3d4ca1994b96f3a0d5084a5

commit_message:
WIP: add max_instances and a wildcard

We want to cap a maximum mdevs we can create.

Change-Id: I94e85297127c7b3b3dc6e6c441025530b0febc84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/900250/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add sg-core backend support in devstack plugin

This change also adds a new variable to set during
devstack deployment: "CEILOMETER_BACKENDS". Its
usage is similar to the "CEILOMETER_BACKEND". The difference
is, that CEILOMETER_BACKENDS expects a comma separated
list of backends (instead of only one backend). The
behavior of CEILOMETER_BACKEND is still the same for
backwards compatibility. If both CEILOMETER_BACKEND
and CEILOMETER_BACKENDS are set, then the value
of CEILOMETER_BACKEND is appended to CEILOMETER_BACKENDS.

The default backend if both "CEILOMETER_BACKEND" and
"CEILOMETER_BACKENDS" are empty is still gnocchi

Change-Id: Ib92fa062784479796c8a2ca4bd69a538e4e05f63
(cherry picked from commit ef237e3c0b946de7e60c97f4434a74d686092e68)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/87/901787/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Gnocchi is the default backind if both "CEILOMETER_BACKEND" # and "CEILOMETER_BACKENDS" are empty CEILOMETER_BACKEND=${CEILOMETER_BACKEND:""} if ! [[ "$CEILOMETER_BACKENDS" =~ "$CEILOMETER_BACKEND" ]]; then CEILOMETER_BACKENDS+=","$CEILOMETER_BACKEND fi CEILOMETER_BACKENDS=${CEILOMETER_BACKENDS:-"gnocchi"} if [[ "$CEILOMETER_BACKENDS" =~ "gnocchi" ]]; thenif [[ "$CEILOMETER_BACKENDS" =~ "sg-core" ]]; then enable_service sg-core fi
deleted_lines: CEILOMETER_BACKEND=${CEILOMETER_BACKEND:-gnocchi} if [ "$CEILOMETER_BACKEND" = "gnocchi" ]; then

commit_message:
Remove glance_available_stores logic from group_vars

This logic has been added to handle TLS condition for glance when ceph
is used.
However, it was never working as `ceph` is not a valid store type, since
it should be `rbd` instead. At the same time logic around available
stores is way more complex.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance/+/901034
Change-Id: I426be7d21ba9267879eadf282f5dd055485b37c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/41/901041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: glance_available_stores: "{{ [ glance_default_store ] + (glance_additional_stores | default([])) }}" glance_use_uwsgi: "{{ ('ceph' not in glance_available_stores) }}"

subject: Add logs in the SampleEndpoint class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-22 09:44:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer/commit/1f714301d46123ad301030f3c93024dcd53e39fc', 'message': 'Add logs in the SampleEndpoint class

While troubleshooting the issue reported on [1], we needed
to see the logs for the push workflow. However, there were
some processes that had no logs to help us identify the issue.

This patch is proposing a log addition, and a raise to an exception,
to facilitate future troubleshootings.

commit_message:
Add logs in the SampleEndpoint class

While troubleshooting the issue reported on [1], we needed
to see the logs for the push workflow. However, there were
some processes that had no logs to help us identify the issue.

This patch is proposing a log addition, and a raise to an exception,
to facilitate future troubleshootings.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ceilometer/+/901607

Change-Id: I36a195965712469e33e73de809f290edd42c8b51

commit_message:
Get private-address for local unit from relation

Currently, the private-address for the local unit is queried using
unit_get, which can cause it to return an address from a different
binding. This patch changes it to always query from the relation.

Depends-on: I9a9efdb5c7e5d3db6dbad11413782b6e07a335c4
Closes-bug: #2020669
Change-Id: I128420c572d5491b9af4cf34614f4534c787d02c
(cherry picked from commit 71100249ee236302ff09d90d49ec66c2fb846829)
(cherry picked from commit 7ff0d9b1c0d2114c580fb9bac370d4bb9f2fc514)

commit_message:
setup: Remove sqlalchemy extra dep

This is already listed in requirements.txt so it's not necessary to
repeat it here.

We also remove the Python version classifiers since they're noise:
'python_requires' does this for us in a machine-readable manner
nowadays.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia2c8a5792c175fb0a8762e61ff76383119251cdd

commit_message:
Introduce pre_workload_launch_workarounds

Sometimes when we restore from image_set we might need
to apply workaround after quiesce before workload launch.

Change-Id: Icda2e1512cd77c9418370267184022859dad7c3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-upgrade refs/changes/13/890913/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: workload launch block: - name: create pre workload_launch workarounds tags: always template: src: workarounds.sh.j2 dest: "{{ working_dir }}/{{ item }}.sh" mode: 0775 force: true loop: - 'pre_workload_launch_workarounds' - name: apply pre workload_launch workarounds shell: | set -o pipefail ./pre_workload_launch_workarounds.sh 2>&1 {{ timestamper_cmd }} >> pre_workload_launch_workarounds.log args: chdir: "{{ working_dir }}" executable: /usr/bin/bash when: ffu_upgrade_workarounds|bool or updates_workarounds|bool tags: always - name: launch workload shell: | set -o pipefail {{ workload_launch_script }} {{(workload_launch_traffic|bool)|ternary("workload_traffic","")}} 2>&1 {{ timestamper_cmd }} >> workload_launch.log args: chdir: "{{ working_dir }}" executable: /usr/bin/bash tags: always
deleted_lines: - name: launch workload shell: | set -o pipefail {{ workload_launch_script }} {{(workload_launch_traffic|bool)|ternary("workload_traffic","")}} 2>&1 {{ timestamper_cmd }} >> workload_launch.log args: chdir: "{{ working_dir }}" executable: /usr/bin/bash

subject: Configure live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-11-17 08:56:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-openstack-hypervisor/commit/b50aa0d02bd4d9d556e6506ba9cf3c7edc7debe4', 'message': "Configure live migration

Configure TLS certificates with the right extensions to be used in an
mTLS environment. (Used by Libvirt and QEMU for native TLS migration).
Ask for new TLS certificate if it's missing the mTLS clientAuth and
ServerAuth extended key usages.
Add extra binding `migration`
Add extra configuration key `use-migration-binding`. It's false by
default, since on current sunbeam installation, there's no space
configuration, all ip addresses are part of the alpha space. Which makes
selecting the right ip address impossible.

Change-Id: Ia0622b12bcac6b90d7a9937695947c113f62d7fe

commit_message:
Configure live migration

Configure TLS certificates with the right extensions to be used in an
mTLS environment. (Used by Libvirt and QEMU for native TLS migration).
Ask for new TLS certificate if it's missing the mTLS clientAuth and
serverAuth extended key usages.
Libvirt/QEMU fail to read CA certificate with chain, therefore it's
templated without the chain.
Add extra binding `migration`.
Add extra configuration key `use-migration-binding`. It's false by
default, since on current sunbeam installation, there's no space
configuration, all ip addresses are part of the alpha space. Which makes
selecting the right ip address impossible.

Change-Id: Ia0622b12bcac6b90d7a9937695947c113f62d7fe

commit_message:
Document new bug deputy role for Ironic

Attempt to create new bug deputy role; because triaging bugs is
important!

Change-Id: Ie11ec93a0f3a3a22d7ffb08c90107522ca1a0a7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/49/900449/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Bug Deputy Guide ================ Ironic has a rotating bug deputy role with assigned responsibilities around ensuring recurring project maintenance occurs, with a specific focus on bug triage. It is the intent that the time commitment of an upstream bug deputy be no more than two to four hours a week on average. Schedule -------- Typically, a bug deputy will serve for a one week period, with the Ironic meeting marking the beginning and end of the term. A bug deputy schedule will be built at the beginning of the OpenStack release cycle and populated by project volunteers. Contributors can select weeks to volunteer for stints as bug deputy. If there are insufficient volunteers, to cover a majority of weeks, the bug deputy program will be cancelled. Responsibilities ---------------- Bug Triage ^^^^^^^^^^ Triage bugs opened in any Ironic project. Links to all Ironic project bugtrackers, filtering for NEW/INCOMPLETE bugs, sorting with newest bugs first: * `ironic <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-inspector <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-inspector/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-python-agent <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-lib <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-lib/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `bifrost <https://bugs.launchpad.net/bifrost/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-prometheus-exporter <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-prometheus-exporter/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-python-agent-builder <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-python-agent-builder/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `ironic-ui <https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic-ui/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `metalsmith <https://bugs.launchpad.net/metalsmith/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `molteniron <https://bugs.launchpad.net/molteniron/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `networking-baremetal <https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-baremetal/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `networking-generic-switch <https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-generic-switch/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `python-ironic-inspector-client <https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-ironic-inspector-client/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `python-ironicclient <https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-ironicclient/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `sushy <https://bugs.launchpad.net/sushy/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `sushy-tools <https://bugs.launchpad.net/sushy-tools/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `tenks <https://bugs.launchpad.net/tenks/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ * `virtualbmc <https://bugs.launchpad.net/virtualbmc/+bugs?field.status%3Alist=NEW&field.status%3Alist=INCOMPLETE_WITH_RESPONSE&orderby=-id>`_ Bug Bash ^^^^^^^^ A bug bash is an informal, synchronous meeting to triage bugs. A bug deputy runs one per week at a time and in a format convenient for them. The selected time and venue for this should be announced on the mailing list and at the Ironic meeting when the bug deputy position is handed over. .. note:: Bug bashes may be discontinued when the backlog of old, untriaged bugs have been worked through. Review Periodic Stable CI Jobs ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ The bug deputy is responsible for reviewing the periodic stable CI jobs once during their week and notifying the community if one fails for a new, non-random reason. The bug deputy should also be prepared to help debug the issue, but is ultimately only responsible for documenting it. * `Periodic Zuul build failures for Ironic/IPA/Ironic-Prom-Exp/Bifrost <https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?project=openstack%2Fironic&project=openstack%2Fironic-python-agent&project=openstack%2Fironic-lib&project=openstack%2Fironic-prometheus-exporter&project=openstack%2Fbifrost&pipeline=periodic&pipeline=periodic-stable&result=FAILURE&result=RETRY_LIMIT&result=POST_FAILURE&result=ERROR&skip=0>`_ * `Periodic Zuul build failures for Ironic UI/NBM/NGS <https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?project=openstack%2Fnetworking-generic-switch&project=openstack%2Fironic-ui&project=openstack%2Fnetworking-baremetal&pipeline=periodic&pipeline=periodic-stable&result=FAILURE&result=RETRY_LIMIT&result=POST_FAILURE&result=ERROR&skip=0>`_ * `Periodic Zuul build failures for inspector-client/sushy/sushy-tools/vbmc/vpdu/ <https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?project=openstack%2Fpython-ironic-inspector-client&project=openstack%2Fsushy&project=openstack%2Fsushy-tools&project=openstack%2Fvirtualbmc&project=openstack%2Fvirtualpdu&pipeline=periodic&pipeline=periodic-stable&result=FAILURE&result=RETRY_LIMIT&result=POST_FAILURE&result=ERROR&skip=0>`_ As of this writing, no other projects under Ironic governance run periodic jobs. Weekly Report ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Once a week, at the end of the bug deputy's term, they should deliver a report to the Ironic meeting and the mailing list. This report should include any concerning bugs or CI breakages, as well as any other issues that the bug deputy feels the community needs to know about. For contributors who do not wish to attend the weekly meeting, a small written report in the meeting agenda is sufficient.

commit_message:
Handle InstanceExists exception for duplicate instance

As of now, when osapi_compute_unique_server_name_scope is set to
``project`` or ``global``, and if there is server create request
with duplicate name (already there is instance exist with same name)
then, instance gets stuck in 'scheduling' task state and vm state
set to ERROR.

This change handle such create request with duplicate name and
catch InstanceExists exception and create instance entry in cell0
for failed request.

This change doesn't check instance name uniqueness across cells.

Partial-Bug: #1857306
Change-Id: I455a8a48aa03781936b6178015ea01b0416376a9

commit_message:
API for hardware interface properties

This spec proposes a set of REST APIs (and CLIs) to get the
properties of hardware interfaces.

The property information will be presented in a machine-readable
fashion.

Change-Id: Ia727f1bd956554121ba443c55f5fb71942a6cbb4
Partial-Bug: 1671549
Partial-Bug: 1655633
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/74/471174/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ===================================== API for hardware interface properties ===================================== * https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1671549 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1655633 Ironic doesn't provide any REST API (or CLI) to get access to the driver properties associated with a dynamic driver (hardware type) and non-default interfaces. This specification describes the API and CLI to address this short-coming. The property information that is returned will be available a more machine-readable detailed view, as compared to the response from the existing ``GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/properties`` request. SHOULD WE STOP using the term **PROPERTIES**. If so, what do we use instead? Problem description =================== There are two issues that we address in this spec: * accessing properties of a driver interface * machine-readable property information There are some notes about this in `Notes on driver properties reform`_ and it was discussed at the `Pike virtual meetup`_. Accessing properties of a driver interface ------------------------------------------ Ironic doesn't provide any REST API (or CLI) to get access to the driver properties associated with a dynamic driver (hardware type) and non-default interfaces. The existing ``GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/properties`` returns the driver-related information that needs to be specified via ``node.driver_info[]``. For classic drivers, this GET request returns all the driver-related properties that are needed for setting the node's driver-related information. However, for dynamic drivers (or hardware types), the GET request returns the driver-related information associated with that hardware type and its **default** interfaces. A node that uses a particular hardware type may not use that hardware type's default interfaces. There is no API that will return all the driver-related information needed for this node. For example, the difference between ``agent_ipmitool`` (classic) and ``ipmi`` (dynamic) drivers is that the response for ``ipmi`` is a subset of ``agent_ipmitool``'s; ``ipmi`` is missing: - image_http_proxy - image_https_proxy - image_no_proxy - ipmi_terminal_console. This is because ``ipmi``'s default console interface is ``no-console`` and default deploy interface is ``iscsi``, whereas ``agent_ipmitool`` uses ``direct`` for the deploy interface (which requires the image_* information) and ``ipmitool-shellinabox`` as the console interface (which requires ``ipmi_terminal_console``). So for a node that has driver = "impi" and console_interface = "ipmitool-shellinabox", there is no way via the API to get the ``ipmi_terminal_console`` driver property. Machine-readable property information ------------------------------------- The property information that is returned from the existing ``GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/properties`` is formatted as follows:: { <property1>: <description> <property2>: <description> } Often the description includes information such as whether the property is required, optional, or if it depends on one or more other property values. The information in its current form is useful for users using the CLI to call this API. However, it isn't so useful for cases when a machine might call this API, for example when trying to build a GUI form for enrolling a node of a particular type. The only option right now is to parse the description string with a REGEX, but with no defined standard this might not always work. The property information that is returned from the new API proposed here, will be in a more machine readable format. Proposed change =============== The existing ``GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/properties`` request returns a list of properties; these properties are from the interfaces associated with the specified driver. We propose an API that allows us to get information about any particular interface. See the `REST API impact`_ section for details of the changes. For the changes to provide machine-readable property information in the API, a more standardised way to define driver properties in the driver modules would be provided, using a similar (or the same) interface as the oslo.cfg opts definitions that allows a driver developer to define a property as an object with fields like required=True and also to type the options like str option or bool option in oslo.cfg. This will allow the Ironic code (that parse, return and validate properties for drivers) to be simpler, more consistent and common across multiple drivers, avoiding the duplication of property parsing we see today in many drivers. Alternatives ------------ For RAID properties, instead of providing that information as part of the response of GET /v1/driver-interfaces/raid/<raid>, we could provide a new request such as GET /v1/driver-interfaces/raid/<raid>/logical-disk-properties. This would be discoverable/linked from GET /v1/driver-interfaces/raid/<raid>/. This would avoid the response from GET /v1/driver-interfaces/raid/<raid> having this additional entry that is not available for any of the other interface types. Data model impact ----------------- None. State Machine Impact -------------------- None. REST API impact --------------- The API microversion would need to be incremented for these new API requests. A new policy rule ``baremetal:driver:interface:get`` will control access to these requests. GET /v1/driver-interfaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The response will include a list of the different interface types. For each interface type, its type and links are provided. The HTTP response code is 200. For example:: { "interface-types": [ { "type": "power", "links": [ { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/v1/driver-interfaces/power", "rel": "self" }, { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/driver-interfaces/power", "rel": "bookmark" } ], }, { "type": "deploy", "links": [ { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/v1/driver-interfaces/deploy", "rel": "self" }, { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/driver-interfaces/deploy", "rel": "bookmark" } ], }, ... ] } GET /v1/driver-interfaces/<interface-type> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This will provide information about the available implementations of the specified interface type. The HTTP response code is 200. For example:: { "interfaces": [ { "name": "ipmitool", "links": [ { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/v1/driver-interfaces/power/ipmitool", "rel": "self" }, { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/driver-interfaces/power/ipmitool", "rel": "bookmark" } ], }, { "name": "fake", "links": [ { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/v1/driver-interfaces/power/fake", "rel": "self" }, { "href": "http://127.0.0.1:6385/driver-interfaces/power/fake", "rel": "bookmark" } ], }, ... ] } GET /v1/driver-interfaces/<interface-type>/<interface> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This will provide a list of the properties for the specified interface. The HTTP response code is 200. For example, if the request was GET /v1/driver-interfaces/power/ipmitool:: { "name": "ipmitool", "properties": { ... }, } where the "properties" dictionary value is described below in `Property information in the response`_. For RAID interfaces, logical_disk_properties will also be included in the response. For example, if the request was GET /v1/driver-interfaces/raid/agent:: { "name": "ipmitool", "properties": { ... }, "logical_disk_properties": { ... }, } TODO: Check with Sam; does he want logical_disk_properties to also be machine-readable like the properties? (I suspect it is easily do-able and makes things consistent.) To go back to our problem of getting the properties for all the driver interfaces associated with a node's driver (a dynamic driver with non-default interfaces), this API can be used to get them as follows: * get the node's hardware (driver) interfaces via ``GET /v1/nodes/<node>`` * for each interface type, invoke ``GET /v1/driver-interfaces/<interface-type>/<name>`` Property information in the response ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The property information in the response will be presented in a machine-readable fashion. It will be returned in JSON as follows:: { <property_name1>: { "description": <description>, "required": <true|false>, "depends-on": [<property_nameM>, <property_nameN>,...] }, <property_name2>: { "description": <description>, "required": <true|false> } } QUESTION. Is it enough to have presence of "depends-on" for determining whether the property is required or not (if it is there, is required = false?), or should required have a third value, eg 'depends'. QUESTION. Should we always return depends-on, even if empty list? Client (CLI) impact ------------------- TODO once we decide on API. "ironic" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~ Changes, if any, to the "ironic" CLI. "openstack baremetal" CLI ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Changes, if any, to the OpenStackClient plugin, "openstack baremetal" CLI. RPC API impact -------------- We will add a new RPC API that makes a call(): ConductorAPI.get_driver_interface_properties(). This will get the properties associated with a particular driver interface. (It is similar to ConductorAPI.get_driver_properties().) Driver API impact ----------------- None. Nova driver impact ------------------ N/A. Ramdisk impact -------------- N/A. Security impact --------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- ironic-ui could provide support for this. Scalability impact ------------------ None. Performance Impact ------------------ Minimal. Instead of one API request to get all the properties for all the interfaces of a driver, a separate request must now be made for each interface of interest. Since this information will continue to be cached in the API service, it will have very minimal impact. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- When writing drivers, the new mechanism for defining driver properties must be used; this will make life easier for the developers :-) Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * rloo (Ruby Loo) Work Items ---------- * new mechanism to represent interface properties, need to change all existing drivers to use this * add RPC API call to get the interface properties & logical_disk_properties * add new REST API, cache properties from RPC API calls. * update API reference * tests (see `Testing`_ section). Dependencies ============ None. Testing ======= * Wherever GET /v1/drivers/<driver>/properties is being tested, this should be tested * unit tests * functional tests Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== These are new API, so no backwards compatibility issues. Documentation Impact ==================== * update the API reference https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/baremetal/ References ========== * `Pike virtual meetup`_ * `Notes on driver properties reform`_ * `Enhance /drivers/properties API to have machine readable detail view`_ .. _`Pike virtual meetup`: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-virtual-meetup .. _`Notes on driver properties reform`: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ironic-driver-properties-reform .. _`Enhance /drivers/properties API to have machine readable detail view`: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ironic/+bug/1655633
